cardTypes.name: Hero
cardTypes.description: Cannot be placed in the play area and the player drops if forced to discard it. If the player drops out due to a power other than the Emperor, the player can get back into the game with the reincarnation card.
cardTypes.about:
The Hero has the power to guide the people but cannot show herself in front of the public.
If found by the Emperor, she will be executed and removed immediately.
However, if the player drops out by someone other than the Emperor, they can revive using the reincarnation card with the power of reincarnation.
(If a player drops out due to the power of the Death, the Soldier or the Boy card, discard all existing cards in hand, and then take the reincarnation card to return to the game.)

cardTypes.name: Emperor
cardTypes.description: Force the designated player to draw a card from the deck and disclose both cards. Then designate one of them to be discarded.
cardTypes.about:
The Emperor is trying to find the Hero and execute her as soon as possible, because she causes disorder to the land with her new teachings.
He can execute the Hero with a sword which has been passed down in the royal family and prevent the Hero's reincarnation.

cardTypes.name: Spirit
cardTypes.description: Exchange hands with a designated player.
cardTypes.about:
The Spirit has been watching the land since ancient times and it is sorrowful for the repeated conflicts among humans.
It hopes to use its special power to let people experience “an interexchange” in their dreams and understand each other's feelings.

cardTypes.name: Scholar
cardTypes.description: The player draws three cards from the deck at the next turn instead of one card, selects one, and returns the rest to the deck.
cardTypes.about:
The Scholar presents three predictions for the land.
The player chooses a card that is most advantageous.
If there are less than three cards left in the deck, take all cards and select one.
(The next player will shuffle the returned cards in the deck. After that, discard one of the two cards and use its power.)

cardTypes.name: Noble
cardTypes.description: Discloses the hand of a designated player. The player with the smaller number drops out. If the numbers are the same, both drop out.
cardTypes.about:
The noble is demanding an early settlement for the stability of the land.
If the number is the same as the player who you challenged, both will drop out.
If there are no other players left, the game will end in a draw.

cardTypes.name: Death
cardTypes.description: Forces a designated player to draw a card from the deck. Specifies a card from their hand to be removed.
cardTypes.about:
An infectious disease called "The Death" is pervasive throughout the land.
The Death takes a life without rhyme or reason.
(Make sure to shuffle the cards in hand before the card is specified by the other player.)

cardTypes.name: Maiden
cardTypes.description: Disables the effects of any card's power on a player until the next turn.
cardTypes.about:
The Maiden generates a fog with prayer that guards the target from attacks.
A player can choose another player to be guarded from another player and that player will be guarded from a card`s power.

cardTypes.name: Fortune Teller
cardTypes.description: Check the hand of a designated player.
cardTypes.about:
The fortune teller has the power of seeing through things.
OA player can check the hand of a designated player.
Do not disclose the outcome of seeing the card to other players.

cardTypes.name: Soldier
cardTypes.description: Can force a designated player to drop out if the player's hand is guessed correctly.
cardTypes.about:
The Soldier is investigating under the order of the Emperor.
The designated player shall answer whether or not the declaration made by the active player is right.
If it was right, the player shall discard the hand and drop out.
Otherwise, the player shall only say that it was incorrect.
There is no need to disclose the card.

cardTypes.name: Boy
cardTypes.description: The first discard has no effect, but the second discard has the same power as the Emperor, 'Public Execution.'
cardTypes.about:
The young Boy is powerless.
However, he eventually grows up and becomes an emperor with the teachings of the Hero.
It seems to be difficult to use the royal sword for the newly enthroned emperor.
If he stabs a Hero, the Hero will revive using the reincarnation card.
On the second discard he has the same power as the Emperor, "Public Execution," but the RANK is 1 for the player who is holding the card.
The player who discards second does not necessarily need to be the same player discarded the first card.

steps: Mix 18 playing cards and place them face down on a table. This is called the deck.
Each player draws a card from the deck and holds it in their hand.
Once everyone has drawn, take one card from the deck and place it face down and sideways next to the deck. This is called the 'reincarnation card.'
Go clockwise from the first player. Be careful not to unintentionally disclose your hand to other players.
The active player draws the card from the top of the deck and adds it to their hand.
The player chooses one card from their hand and places it in the play area, activating its power.
The played card is discarded, arranged face-up in a line for all players to see.
The turn ends after the power is activated, and the next player takes their turn in a clockwise order.
Repeat until all cards in the deck are gone or only one player remains.

specialRules.dropOut: If a player drops out due to a card's power, their hand is revealed and added to their discard pile.
specialRules.designatedPlayer: Certain card effects target specific players. The active player can choose any other player but cannot target themselves.
specialRules.inactiveEffect: If a card is forced to be discarded, its power does not activate. If no cards remain in the deck during an effect, the game ends.

endConditions.description: The game ends when there are no cards left in the deck after a player's turn. Players reveal their hands, and the highest card strength wins. A tie occurs if strengths are equal.
If only one player remains while others have dropped out, they are declared the winner.
If all players drop out due to a tie during the Noble card's effect, the game ends in a draw.
